sections.text:
45-343.Main office or branch office; move or relocate; procedure.

A licensee may move its main office or may relocate a branch office from one location to another without obtaining a new license if the licensee gives notice thereof to the director through the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry at least thirty days prior to such move and pays a filing fee of one hundred fifty dollars. The director may, at the director's discretion, hold a hearing on the relocation request, in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act. The expense of any such hearing shall be paid by the licensee.

SourceLaws 1965, c. 268, ยง 10, p. 763;Laws 1977, LB 40, ยง 254;Laws 2003, LB 217, ยง 35;Laws 2025, LB474, ยง 64.Operative Date: October 1, 2025

Cross ReferencesAdministrative Procedure Act, see section 84-920.
